annotation.TEXT: And now we get to wreck up the Hall of Champions. Aside from fighting off the guards, you can also break the paintings here for a few rewards such as gems and cipher coins (that, and sometimes there's guards hiding behind the paintings, somehow).

And now it's time to do basically the exact same thing, but with new music and a time limit. If you don't want to sit through the second round of this (and I don't blame you, to be honest), feel free to skip ahead to 11:44.

As mentioned in the last segment, I actually forgot about an upgrade that Chester sells you in the armor outpost (how I managed to walk by him without thinking of it is beyond me). Either way, the upgrade itself is very useful, as buying it will allow you to hold 10 health potions instead of the standard 5.

The Smoke Bomb is basically Plague Knight's version of the Phase Locket, only not as good. The smoke bomb itself will float straight ahead for a moment before activating, at which point you can stand inside the cloud it creates to avoid damage. You can still attack while you're invulnerable, but you still have to make sure you're standing within the cloud itself (as it continues to move as well). Granted, the invincibility sort of lingers for a moment after you step out of the cloud, but it's still not that useful.
